data.meta_description: Roger Martin du Gard (1881-1958): French author and winner of the 1937 Nobel Prize for Literature. Trained as a paleographer and archivist, Martin du Gard brought to his works a spirit of objectivity and a scrupulous regard for details... His major work was Les Thibault, a roman fleuve about the Thibault family, originally published as a series of eight novels.
